oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ongoing outbreak of invasive listeriosis, Germany, 2012 to 2015
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ruppitsch, Werner
Prager, Rita
Halbedel, Sven
Hyden, Patrick
Pietzka, Ariane
Huhulescu, Steliana
Lohr, Dorothee
Schönberger, Katharina
Aichinger, Elisabeth
Hauri, Anja
Stark, Klaus
Vygen, Sabine
Tietze, Erhard
Allerberger, Franz
Wilking, Hendrik
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Germany
listeriosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: European Centre for Disease Control and Prevention (ECDC)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>Listeriosis patient isolates in Germany have shown a new identical pulsed-field gel electrophoresis (PFGE) pattern since 2012 (n = 66). Almost all isolates (<jats:italic>Listeria monocytogenes</jats:italic> serotype 1/2a) belonged to cases living in southern Germany, indicating an outbreak with a so far unknown source. Case numbers in 2015 are high (n = 28). No outbreak cases outside Germany have been reported. Next generation sequencing revealed the unique cluster type CT1248 and confirmed the outbreak. Investigations into the source are ongoing.</jats:p>
